texto: 6.1.1 Suitability The capability of the software product to provide an appropriate set of functions for specified tasks and user objectives. NOTE 1 Examples of appropriateness are task-oriented composition of functions from constituent sub-functions, and capacities of tables. NOTE 2 Suitability corresponds to suitability for the task in ISO 9241-10. NOTE 3 Suitability also affects operability.
